page.title: 14STOWEY WATER TREATMENT WORKS
page.content: Water from the Chew Valley Lake is treated here before being pumped to the service reservoirs belonging to Bristol Waterworks Company and Bath Corporation.The water is passed through beds of sand to purify it and remove any waste material. It is then chlorinated and the ph value adjusted to 7.8 by the addition of carefully controlled amounts of caustic soda. The pure clean water is then ready for consumption. The twelve pumps are capable of handling nine million gallons of water daily.
